main_definition: Exhaustive, complete, or meticulous in approach; ensuring no detail is missed.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Careful and detailed; paying attention to every aspect of a task or situation.
meanings_and_examples.example: She was thorough when cleaning the house, making sure not to miss any spots.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Comprehensive and exhaustive; leaving no stone unturned in an investigation or search.
meanings_and_examples.example: The detective conducted a thorough search of the crime scene for evidence.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Diligent, persistent in pursuing something until it is achieved; not giving up easily.
meanings_and_examples.example: He was thorough in his attempts to learn the new language, practicing every day without fail.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In-depth and exhaustive examination or analysis of a subject.
meanings_and_examples.example: The researchers conducted a thorough review of all available literature on the topic.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Sensitive to details; noticing even minor nuances in an observation or discussion.
meanings_and_examples.example: His report was so thorough that he included every single detail, no matter how small.
